author: Special Correspondent
text:
Controller of Examinations of Periyar University S. Leela handing over the best organiser award to G. V. Kumar, Krishnagiri district organiser of Youth Red Cross Movement, in Salem on Monday.

The three day zonal level orientation training programme for Youth Red Cross (YRC) volunteers and programme officers got under way at the Periyar University here on Monday.

The event has been organised jointly by the Tamil Nadu branch of the Indian Red Cross Society and Youth Red Cross unit of Periyar University.

S. Leela, Controller of Examinations of Periyar University, hoisted the Red Cross flag and inaugurated the training programme.

She insisted the service motive among the students and benefits.

J. Senthilvelmurugan, Syndicate Member of Periyar University, P. Thirumoorthi, Zonal Co-ordinator of YRC, offered felicitations.

P. Vadivel, G. V. Kumar, K. S. Loganathan and R. Sakthi, district organisers of YRC and J. Munna, Chairman, IRCS, Salem district, were present at the inaugural.

Dr. Leela gave away awards to the outstanding YRC volunteers and district organisers on the occasion.

Experts from different fields gave lectures on different topics.More than 100 YRC volunteers and progamme officers of affiliated colleges from Salem, Dharmapuri, Namakkal and Krishnagiri districts are participating in the training programme.
title: Work with service motive, students told
